citation.article-title: Ureaplasma canigenitalium sp. nov., isolated from dogs.

p.s: Description of Ureaplasma canigenitalium sp. nov.
Ureaplasma canigenitalium (ca.ni.ge.ni.ta'li.um. L. n . canis, dog; M. L. pl. n. genitalia, genitals; M. L. pl. gen. n. canigenitalium, of canine genitalia)
Morphological and physical characteristics.
Pleomorphic cells are bounded by a single unit membrane.
Colonies have a typical fried egg appearance on agar.
Organisms are filterable through 450-nm-pore-size membrane filters and are resistant to penicillin.
Growth characteristics.
Requires sterol.
Inhibited by digitonin.
Optimal growth occurs at 36 to 37Â°C under aerobic and anaerobic conditions.
Metabolic characteristics.
Urea is hydrolyzed; glucose is not metabolized; and arginine is not hydrolyzed.
Serological characteristics.
Serologically distinct from all other Ureaplasma species.
DNA base composition.
The DNA base composition is 28.7 mol% guanine-plus-cytosine.
Habitat.
The habitat is canine prepuces, vaginas, and oral and nasal cavities.
Type strain.
The type strain is strain D6P-C (= ATCC 51252).
